title: Screenshot-style Internet Identity login screen redesign

requirements.summary: Redesign the logged-out login screen layout to match the provided screenshot (dark background + large white rounded sheet, title, sign-up row, email/password fields, forgot link, bottom primary CTA).
acceptanceCriteria: When logged out, the app renders a login screen that matches the screenshotâ€™s layout and spacing (dark top/background + white sheet + large rounded inputs + bottom CTA).
The layout is mobile-first and remains usable on desktop (content centered with sensible max width).

All user-facing text on this screen is in English and matches the screenshot wording (including capitalization and punctuation) unless Internet Identity constraints require additional clarifying copy (handled in REQ-2).

file_operations.description: Replace the current card/alert-based logged-out UI with screenshot-style layout and spacing using Tailwind classes (dark full-screen background/header feel + centered white rounded sheet + required text rows + large rounded email/password fields + bottom full-width rounded primary CTA). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Keep Internet Identity as the only auth method while presenting email/password-style fields; wire Continue to useInternetIdentity().login with loading state and add concise helper copy explaining II.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Continue" starts the Internet Identity login flow and shows a loading state consistent with the rest of the app (e.g., spinner + disabled CTA) while loginStatus is "logging-in".
No API calls, backend mutations, or local storage mechanisms are introduced for email/password authentication.
A concise, visible explanation indicates that login is via Internet Identity (and not email/password), without reintroducing the old large alert card UI.

file_operations.description: Ensure the "Continue" CTA calls useInternetIdentity().login and reflects loginStatus === 'logging-in' with disabled + spinner/label change; keep email/password fields as non-auth inputs (ignored and/or disabled) and add a short inline helper line (non-card) indicating Internet Identity is used. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add screenshot-like interactions: password visibility toggle, link styling for Forgot Password and Sign up, and robust disabled/pressed CTA states.
acceptanceCriteria: Password field includes a visibility toggle that switches between masked/unmasked states and is keyboard accessible.

"Forgot Password?" and "Sign up" are rendered as links/buttons with hover/focus styles and do not break navigation (they may open an informational modal/toast explaining Internet Identity if no dedicated routes exist).
The primary CTA reflects disabled state while logging in and cannot be double-submitted.

file_operations.description: Implement a password visibility toggle button inside the password input (keyboard accessible, uses existing icon library already in use), style "Forgot Password?" and "Sign up" as links with hover/focus states, and prevent double-submission by disabling the CTA while logging in (including active/pressed styling). If no routes exist, have links open a small non-intrusive informational dialog/toast about Internet Identity or an external Internet Identity help/sign-up page. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
